DataElement.preferredName: International Prognostic Index Risk Assessment Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the risk group description of how an individual with non-Hodgkin lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A list of five factors that help doctors assess how a non-Hodgkin lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy.  The factors are: 1) patient's age, 2) stage of disease: an indication of how localized or widespread is the disease, 3) LDH levels: serum levels often correlate with the amount of tumor in the body, 4) the number of extranodal, non-lymphatic sites found, 5) the patient's overall health. (from Lymphoma Research Foundation of America glossary (www.lymphoma.org))_The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0386214-CDE Import - IPI Score request by Pam. 6.10.19 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A list of five factors that help doctors assess how a non-Hodgkin lymphoma patient might respond to a certain treatment or predict the risk of disease recurrence and survival following therapy.  The factors are: 1) patient's age, 2) stage of disease: an indication of how localized or widespread is the disease, 3) LDH levels: serum levels often correlate with the amount of tumor in the body, 4) the number of extranodal, non-lymphatic sites found, 5) the patient's overall health. (from Lymphoma Research Foundation of America glossary (www.lymphoma.org))_A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A risk group associated with a total score of 4 or 5 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a 5 year survival prognosis of 32%.
A risk group associated with a total score of 3 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a 5 year survival prognosis of 46%.
A risk group associated with a total score of 2 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a 5 year survival prognosis of 69%.
A risk group associated with a total score of 0 or 1 on the International Prognostic Index indicating that an individual has a 5 year survival prognosis of 73%.
